page.title: 13MILLS OBSERVATORY, DUNDEE
page.content: This astronomical observatory, situated on the top of{BALGAY HILL }in the centre of Dundee, has the largest telescope available to the general public in Britain. Opened in 1935, the observatory has a dome-roofed observation room equipped with a{10 inch Cooke } {refractor telescope}for the study of the night sky, and{several large {terrestrial telescopes}are installed on the balcony, giving extensive views across the River Tay. The viewing has been improved by the reduction in the amount of smoke in the atmosphere after the closing of many mills; this is offset by the glow of extensive street lighting. The observatory is also involved in national & international co-operation such as the observation of{Halley's {Comet,}due in early 1986.
